title: Could Travel Sizes Get Sent Packing?

summary: Botswana, a 15 percent owner of De Beers and the world’s largest diamond producer by value, is considering buying Anglo’s De Beers stake.

summary: The Swiss luxury company experienced a significant decline in first-half 2025 sales despite growth in other regions like North America.

summary: From Kering to Nike to Everlane, fashion and beauty companies are turning to fixers to get back on track — with mandates to steady finances, reset culture and reignite consumer desire.

summary: Apparel prices are rising, supply chains are scrambling, and brands are playing defence as a new wave of Trump-era tariffs threatens to shake the global fashion industry. Joan Kennedy and Marc Bain join The Debrief to explain the latest changes.

Weaker currencies in key export markets and a darkening China market are set to add further pressure to luxury firms this quarter.

title: How Afro Fashion Association Empowers Underrepresented Designers
summary: Michelle Ngonmo’s talent incubator, founded in Italy in 2015, platforms and supports BIPOC fashion talent and creatives while building bridges between hubs in Cameroon, Rwanda and Ghana to fashion capitals like Milan, and soon, Paris. title: Trump Says Indonesia Goods to Face 19% Tariff Under New Pact
summary: Indonesia also agreed to purchase $15 billion in US energy, $4.5 billion worth of agricultural products and 50 Boeing Co. jets, “many of them 777’s,” Trump said later on social media.

summary: LVMH’s high-end cashmere firm cultivated unassailable luxury credentials with its commitment to quality and craft. According to Italian prosecutors, thousands of its cashmere jackets were made in illegal, Chinese-owned workshops on the outskirts of Milan.

title: Big Beauty Bets on Standardised Eco-Scores. Will It Pay Off?

summary: A year after Josh Schulman became CEO of the British mega-brand. investors say they’re pleased with early signs of recovery even though sales are still falling.

summary: The results suggest that efforts to branch into new products and categories — part of the company’s focus on what it calls 'head-to-toe denim lifestyle' — are paying off.

summary: The sale at Sotheby’s in Paris broke the global record for most valuable handbag ever sold at auction.

summary: The British luxury brand secures fresh funding and board support amid declining sales.

summary: This week’s round-up of global markets fashion business news also features Nykaa’s Hong Kong investor, Reliance Retail in India and Nigeria’s mooted textile hub.

summary: Looming ‘reciprocal’ US tariffs threaten the profitability of larger suppliers and the viability of smaller ones in countries like Vietnam, Cambodia and Indonesia where some factories already face cancelled orders and worker layoffs.

summary: From Tiffany blue to Barbie pink, distinctive colours are driving consumer interest in a slowing watch market, helping industry giants like Rolex and startups like Norqain alike court new buyers — especially younger collectors and women.

summary: At The Business of Fashion’s roundtable in London, executive members and the editorial team explored why shoppers’ behaviour has become more unpredictable, and how brands can adjust.

summary: Chanel at 110, Armani at 91, Me at Midnight: Tuesday in Paris was that kind of day, writes Tim Blanks.

summary: The celebrity hairstylist behind iconic looks like "The Rachel" is debuting seven styling essentials, marking his foray into the prestige hair care market.

summary: Slate Brands introduced Iris Lane — billed in her Instagram profile as "the first AI perfume influencer" — on July 10 and swiftly caught backlash from members of the fragrance community.

summary: The brand was founded by Diarrha N'Diaye-Mbaye in 2021.

summary: The brand’s first New York City store is located at 132 Greene Street.

summary: The line will include ingredient-conscious products, including kale cleanser, niacinamide vitamin boost serum, eye shimmers and collagen and retinol serum.

title: Layoffs Hit Shiseido Americas
summary: The company confirmed the job cuts but declined to quantify them.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Menopause Solutions Company Alloy Is Doubling Down on Skin Care With Estrogen-based Products
summary: Following the success of its M4 Collagen Builder Rx Face Cream more than two years ago, the company is now investing in a robust skin care range.

title: Puig CEO Talks Tariffs, Pricing
summary: The company’s second-quarter sales reached 1.09 billion euros.

title: Beauty’s Race to Snap Up This Year’s Cast of ‘Love Island USA’ Has Begun
summary: The show's seventh — and most-viewed — season to date closed this week, and beauty brands already appear to be signaling interest in cast collaborations.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Redken Launches New Artistic Ambassador Network with Sabrina Carpenter’s Hairstylist Evanie Frausto and More
summary: The collective will also feature an additional 19 irrevocable talents across celebrity hairstyling and coloring, as well as a handful of educators.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter: Maëlys plans to replicate the success of its Booty Mask with its latest launch
summary: According to a recent report from data analytics firm Consumer Edge, Maëlys — the body-care brand best known for its B-Tight Lift & Firm Booty Mask — ranked as the second fastest-growing DTC beauty brand in the first half of 2025, topped only by Hailey Bieber’s billion-dollar baby, Rhode. Now, it's expanding.

title: Glossy Podcast: Saks Global, Inditex’s fast fashion ambitions, Richemont’s success — and the future of golf fashion with the founders of Malbon
summary: We speak with Stephen and Erica Malbon, the co-founders of Malbon Golf. Malbon is known for its edgy, irreverent takes on traditional golf attire at a time when the sport is more popular than ever.

title: Rent the Runway increases subscription prices, citing inflationary pressures
summary: In a late April interview for the Glossy Podcast, when asked whether she expected tariffs to affect Rent the Runway’s membership pricing, co-founder and CEO Jennifer Hyman told Glossy she was “taking it day by day” and had planned to sit down with 20 brand partners the following week to discuss how they’d “handle this together.”

title: What beauty’s latest ‘dupe lawsuits’ tell us about its changing relationship with inspiration and IP
summary: Beauty dupes have never been more popular. The same goes for the lawsuits that try to remove them from store shelves. Glossy spoke to trademark attorneys to unpack recent cases between Benefit and E.l.f. Beauty, Sol de Janeiro and MCoBeauty, Supergoop! versus Five Below, and more, to understand the industry impact.

title: Fashion Briefing: Rolex’s lower-priced sister brand Tudor is growing as luxury watch prices keep climbing
summary: Despite its focus on affluence and luxury, Rolex, one of the biggest brands in the category, is having surprising success from its lower-priced brand, Tudor.

title: Analyzing beauty’s latest dupe lawsuits with trademark attorney Elizabeth Milian, plus industry news
summary: Brand protection attorney Elizabeth Milian joins the Glossy Beauty Podcast to unpack recent beauty industry lawsuits around product dupes.

title: How Scentbird scented a movie for its latest marketing activation
summary: Subscription fragrance platform Scentbird is taking an innovative approach to fragrance marketing through its integrations with pop culture and entertainment. For example, most recently — as a launch event for its new fragrance set — it hosted a "scent-a-long" of "I Know What You Did Last Summer" during a pre-release screening of the film on Tuesday.

title: Luxury Briefing: How Ralph Lauren is benefitting from Wimbledon’s growing fashion influence
summary: In this week's Luxury Briefing, a look at the fashion brand winners of this year's Wimbledon, the designer response to the changes happening with London Fashion Week, recent moves from Marni and Galeries Lafayette, and news to know.

title: Inside the Loro Piana scandal: Labor abuse, court oversight and the myth of sustainable luxury
summary: Loro Piana, the ultra-luxury Italian brand owned by LVMH, was placed under judicial administration on July 14, after the Milan Tribunal found evidence of worker exploitation in its Italian supply chain. The 26-page court ruling, reviewed by Glossy, reveals how the brand subcontracted the production of its garments through front companies to Chinese-owned factories in Lombardy. The factories were operating in breach of multiple safety and labor laws.

title: Beauty & Wellness Briefing: Why Sephora tapped Lyft to compete with Amazon’s Prime Day sale
summary: This week, I checked in with Sephora CMO Zena Arnold and Lyft evp Suzie Reider to learn about last week’s “delivered to beauty” activation, which provided direct competition to Amazon's Prime Days sale through discounted rides to Sephora stores. Additionally, L’Oréal-owned Maybelline sponsors WWE wrestling, Wonderskin becomes an Amazon category leader, and executive moves at Superdrug, Galderma and Nest New York.

title: Inside Citizens of Humanity’s plan to build up its men’s business
summary: Los Angeles fashion brand Citizens of Humanity has launched exclusive products with Mr Porter and held IRL events at Paris Men's Fashion Week to help boost its men's business.

title: A ‘disruption in discovery’: What Google and Instagram’s new search partnership means for brands
summary: On Friday, the internet giant began indexing Instagram content. With the new feature, Google is keeping apace with younger internet users who are increasingly turning to social media platforms as their search engines.

title: Juicy Couture expands its fragrance offering with Just Moi
summary: On Monday, Juicy Couture — a brand inherent to the young adulthoods of many millennial women — is launching its newest scent, Just Moi. Its goal is to win over the 18- to 34-year-old demographic, which includes those who grew up with the brand and those discovering it for the first time.

title: Tourism is declining around the world. How can fashion brands respond?
summary: The luxury fashion industry has historically benefited from wealthy tourists traveling around the world to do their shopping. But in the first half of 2025, tourism to many of fashion’s traditional destination markets has been slumping.

title: Glossy Pop Newsletter — Exclusive: Ulta doubles down on K-beauty with 13 new brands
summary: On Friday, Ulta Beauty announced the introduction of 13 new K-beauty brands across makeup and skin care to its e-commerce site. The new brands will launch in-store throughout the summer.

title: Glossy Podcast: Prime Day data, Meta’s EssilorLuxottica investment, a New Guards Group update — and fashion brands’ Amazon playbook
summary: This week, we’re putting the focus on Amazon’s Prime Day event, along with the counter-programming from some of its biggest rivals like Walmart. Early data indicates that people may have shopped less this Prime Day, and when they are shopping, two-thirds of their purchases are under $20.

title: Ulta Beauty acquires UK retailer Space NK to power its international expansion
summary: Ulta Beauty announced Thursday that it has purchased U.K.-based specialty beauty retailer SpaceNK Limited from PE firm Manzanita Capital. Space NK currently operates 83 specialty beauty stores across the UK and Ireland and sold its internal U.S. distribution company, which served Bloomingdale’s and Nordstrom, to PCA Companies in 2024. Ulta Beauty’s acquisition will help to fuel CEO Kecia Steelman’s “Ulta Beauty Unleashed” plan, which also includes international expansion through global franchise managers into Mexico City, Kuwait City and Dubai later this year.

title: Fashion Briefing: J.Crew is betting on global activations amid rising American interest in Europe
summary: In this week's Fashion Briefing, a look at J.Crew's focus on Europe, which aligns with consumers' interests. Also, early insights from Prime Day and back-to-school, executive moves at Parker Thatch and Vuori, and news to know.

title: Why customer brand trips are core to Cocokind’s marketing strategy
summary: In January, Cocokind hosted seven longtime customers in the Napa Valley for a trip designed to give them experiences traditionally only afforded to influencers. It hosted another customer trip in June.

title: Debut Biotech’s Joshua Britton on the breakthrough beetle pigment set to disrupt beauty, plus Amazon Prime sale news
summary: What do beetles and red lipstick have in common? More than you may think.
